setup.question: How many other expeditions ventured to the planet without noticing the city?

Text.text: The story follows several men exploring a mysterious city on an otherwise-barren planet. The city has a lot of spooky elements. There's a shield (which the men conclude to be a radiation shield) that goes up around the entire city while a couple of the men are inside, and the story mostly follows them trying to figure out what's up with the city and getting out. So I guess that's all there is to say on the question.
The 11th still didn't know about the city. As of 11 expeditions, nobody noticed the city.
Since this is the 11th expedition, I'm just looking for a last bit of proof which states that the 11th expedition did in fact venture into the city.
Sure. When they decide to go in:

This quote just indicates that an expedition eventually reached the city. Note that both quotes in the first round indicate that the 11th flight didn't have any knowledge of the city. The 11th never gained any information. It was after the 11th that the city began to be explored.

answers.other: I don't think there was much room for debater B to make an argument, this was kind of a really easy question that debater A could just point to one line in the text to prove their answer.
answers.judge strategies: I asked for clarification on the number of past expeditions, which is factual and very difficult to argue against.
answers.reason for outcome: Debater A gave me a really clear-cut statement to vote off of, there wasn't much interpretation/wiggle room for debater B.
answers.interface: Scrolling issue, which has been fixed.

answers.other: There was absolutely nothing for A. It says 10 verbatim.

answers.reason for outcome: The answer is directly evident in a couple of easy quotes, while the dishonest debater had nothing to latch on to.
